head.title: Home - Frederick County Public Schools

meta.content: Frederick County Public Schools is the 22nd largest of 134 school divisions in Virginia and serves more than 13,500 students. It is the mission of Frederick County Public Schools to ensure all students an excellent education.

meta.name: description
meta.content: Frederick County Public Schools is the 22nd largest of 134 school divisions in Virginia and serves more than 13,500 students. It is the mission of Frederick County Public Schools to ensure all students an excellent education.

div.h1:
An innovative community where caring relationships
and authentic learning inspire all students.

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

a.title: FCPS Provides Free Meals During School Closure

img.title: #8f4f27540a8f48a09ab29631d8bfa7d7
img.alt: FCPS Provides Free Meals During School Closure

a.title: H.N. Funkhouser & Co Present Grants to Schools

img.title: #c857796de454491285eedc8d99c1e7ae
img.alt: H.N. Funkhouser & Co Present Grants to Schools

a.title: Team Frederick Wins First Place at the National Association of Home Builders’ International Builders’ Show.

img.title: #3d3d67c3dbf0465ab500f28c2c374370
img.alt: Team Frederick Wins First Place at the National Association of Home Builders’ International Builders’ Show.

div.p: Since beginning to use Peachjar to distribute eflyers in March 2016, FCPS has saved nearly 9.8 million sheets of paper which equates to 1,173 trees saved.
FCPS continues to offer free meals to school-aged students each weekday at numerous locations.
Construction of the replacement Robert E. Aylor Middle School is continuing. The school is scheduled to open for the start of the 2021-22 school year.
For the 19th consecutive year, Handy Mart and H.N. Funkhouser & Company have partnered with the ExxonMobil Educational Alliance to provide each school with a $500 grant to support math and science.
James Wood High School senior Alexsandra Smith has been honored with one of just 11 Harry F. Byrd, Jr. Leadership Awards and a $15,000 scholarship.
Congratulations to Team Frederick for winning first place for Construction Management and Rookie of the Year Award at the National Association of Home Builders’ International Builders’ Show.
The cold, winter weather isn't slowing down progress on the construction of Jordan Springs Elementary School.

img.title: Coronavirus Update
img.br:
Graduation ceremonies will be held virtually this year. James Wood, Millbrook and Sherando high schools are also looking at additional opportunities to recognize graduating seniors, including the possibility of having students receive their diplomas at their school during a controlled event at which social distancing and other recommended safety actions are practiced.
Information on FCPS Response to COVID-19
Información sobre la respuesta de FCPS a COVID-19
Services Offered by FCPS During School Closures
Servicios proporcionados por FCPS durante Cierres de Escuelas

a.title: Graduation Ceremonies to Be Held Virtually Due to COVID-19 Pandemic

div.a: Graduation Ceremonies to Be Held Virtually Due to COVID-19 Pandemic
div.div: Graduation ceremonies at James Wood, Millbrook and Sherando high schools will be held virtually this year. The three high schools are also looking at additional opportunities to recognize graduating seniors, including the possibility of having students receive their diplomas at their school during a controlled event at which social distancing and other recommended safety actions are practiced.
div.a: Read More about Graduation Ceremonies to Be Held Virtually Due to COVID-19 Pandemic

div.div: Report Card Distribution- Report cards for the third nine weeks (through March 13) will be e-mailed to parents on Monday, April 27. Paper report cards will be mailed by April 30 to those parents for whom the school division does not have an e-mail address.
div.a: Read More about Report Card Distribution

a.title: State Superintendent Announces Launch of “VA TV Classroom” by VA Public TV Stations

div.a: State Superintendent Announces Launch of “VA TV Classroom” by VA Public TV Stations
div.div: The Virginia Department of Education and several public television stations are partnering to broadcast teacher-led classroom instruction across the state. The instruction is aligned to the commonwealth's academic standards.
div.a: Read More about State Superintendent Announces Launch of “VA TV Classroom” by VA Public TV Stations

div.div: Millbrook High School Technology Education Teacher Matt Brame is utilizing some of the school division’s 3-D printers to make face shields to support Valley Health and Lord Fairfax Health District employees who are on the front lines in the battle with COVID-19. To date, more than 50 face shields have been created. Valley Health is providing funding to support the effort.
div.a: Read More about Millbrook Teacher Makes Face Shields

div.div: The Frederick County Circuit Court has issued a final order in response to the Frederick County School Board’s Petition for Relocation and Reinterment of the Abandoned Graveyard discovered at the site of the replacement Robert E. Aylor Middle School on White Oak Road in Stephens City.
div.a: Read More about Public Notice: Circuit Court Order

div.div: Student registration plans have been finalized for students who have moved to Frederick County and not yet enrolled in FCPS and for rising first-12th grade students who plan to enroll in FCPS for the 2020-21 school year.
The latest edition of Frederick County Public Schools’ E-newsletter FCPS Focus is now available.
div.a: Read More about FCPS Focus - April 2, 2020

div.div: All families with students enrolled in FCPS are being asked to visit Parent/Student 360 to verify that their contact information is accurate. In addition, students are reminded to check their FCPS e-mail at least once each day so they don't miss any important information that may be sent to them by their school.
div.a: Read More about Verify Contact Information

National School Public Relations Association
img.br: The FCPS division website received an Award of Excellence from NSPRA, the National School Public Relations Association, in the 2017 National School Communication Awards Contest.

div.br:
Frederick County Public Schools Equity Program has a goal of growing cultural and social empathy within the school division and ensuring all students have access to rigorous learning experiences. In this video, students and staff discuss the equity initiative and how it's helping individuals recognize there's value and strength in the school division's diversity. Read the FCPS Equity Program video transcript.
Check out the FCPS Media on YouTube for more videos like this one.
